job_description: Co-op 7750 Service Router Software Tester                   Number of openings: 3This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-Op or Intern Program at a Canadian College or University.The successful candidate will work in a team of highly motivated and talented software engineers, responsible for delivering new capabilities on the 7750 Service Router of Alcatel-Lucent’s IP Division. This router portfolio continued to gain market share in 2011, taking the overall #2 position in the worldwide IP router market. Work on the world’s highest quality IP router and be part of a team which truly cares and has a passion to win.Example duties:• Perform testing of new line cards, media adapters and platform features on the 7750 SR product family• Verify driver-level software, FPGA firmware and packet data path• Test functional enhancements to areas such as BGP and IPSEC• Test traffic mirroring performance on a variety of switch fabric variants and line cards• Work closely with testers and developers to investigate and resolve issues• Verify software bug fixes• Automate test cases and suites in a standard regression environment (Linux-based)• Improve regression tests to run faster and more reliably• Monitor regression to ensure that new code does not break existing functionality• Build test networks, work with cutting-edge hardware (eg. 100GE technology) and use test equipment for traffic generation and protocol emulation• Learn and use network protocols to configure high capacity routers (XRS/SR12) to route Tera-bits per second worth of traffic• Develop tools that will be used by the whole engineering team to help debug test case failures
job_requirements: Key skills:• Strong analytical / troubleshooting skills• A curiosity to learn, reverse engineer, and tear apart a feature or a design (i.e., research and understand your area inside and out in order to test it thoroughly)• Solid programming skills (TCL/TK an asset)• Good interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills• Quick learner, self starter, able to work independently• Strong sense of ownership and accountability• Passion for qualityDesirable skills:• Desire to work with new cutting-edge hardware• Knowledge of some of the IP networking protocols• Experience with test automation• Comfortable working in a Unix/Linux environmentAlcatel-Lucent Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, Aboriginal persons, persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply.Open To All Majors:No
